now most flowers that you find in the

based flowers so in front of me here I
have all-purpose flour all-purpose flour
again is made from that hard wheat but
the difference here is that in
all-purpose flour what happens is you
take the wheat with its three components
the first is the endosperm then there's
the bran and the germ now the endosperm
is all that's left when you have
all-purpose flour the other two items
are milled out of the flour and that
gives you something that's great for all
sorts of items that's why all purpose
gets its name you can use it for
biscuits you can use it for breads you
could use it for pizza dough's and the
overall protein content of all-purpose
flour is about 10 to 12 percent so it
kind of lives in the middle maybe a
little higher up on the protein scale
but it gives strength and structure but
it also has a certain amount of
lightness to it for so many different
things and next to all-purpose we have
whole wheat flour now whole wheat flour
it has that same endosperm in it that
all-purpose does but it also has the two
other components of the wheat kernel
it has the germ and it has the brand now
different brands of flowers will have

you'll notice a difference in color
right because it has more of the

now one thing you want to know about
whole wheat flour is that it has a
higher oil content in it than the
all-purpose flour and that's due to the
wheat germ that's in here now whole
wheat flours they add a lot of great
fiber to whatever you're making with it
and then oftentimes your baked items
will be a little denser in texture and
so you sometimes want to mix all-purpose
flour and whole wheat flour to get
